title: Left handed champs
body: Why are there soooo many left handed champions in this game?! Seriously, I know I'm not the first to notice it...Pantheon is an example...he is left handed....(he would never have been a spartan because of that..unless he is ambidextrous. Ashe too, and kayle...lots of others. why rito!? who there is left handed?

replies.body: It just seemed right.
No other options were left...
Phreak? Is that you?
How many bad jokes left?

This has always been one of those little things that bothered me as well. 

The two conclusions I came to were either 

A) Lots of left handed artists at Riot, or..
B) It's viewed as being "special" (And it kinda loses it's special-ness when it's way over-abundant)

It's definitely a nitpick, but it just doesn't sit right for some people, and frankly nothing, at all, is gained or lost by such an arbitrary choice. 

I know it bothers the hell out of me that there's a boatload of lefthanded champions, ***wayyyyyyyy*** more than there statistically should be (except for the whole "lala fantasy universe lala" response). 

It's just sort of a really annoying tidbit, and makes me, and I'm assuming others, get a "mary sue" vibe. When it's only supposed to make up like 10% of the population, it just doesn't feel right that it's basically the default in the game. 

But hey, that's just me. 
It causes the same kind of "*sigh*, was this *really* necessary?" response in my head as every chick being a supermodel with massive knockers.
If you take a rare thing and make it absurdly common, it just doesn't make the world convincing.

My guess is its just an aesthetics thing... ie the champions just look better or whatever during their animations that way. If you look at pantheons splash art 2 of them he has his spear in his right hand. And he isnt a spartan despite his armor, he is Rakkor a Riot made up tribe, so Spartan references only go so far before its irrelevant.
its because the world is made for right handed people and we need representation, and making a majority of the champs lefties makes us feel included ya damn righty.
I suspect there are sinister motives at work.
Left hand. Hmph. Stronger. Hmph. RIGHT ARM. {{champion:23}}

I don't think Pantheon holding the spear in his left hand makes him left handed. From what I remember of this sort of stuff the shield is generally held in the dominant hand because it's larger and heavier, requiring more strength to hold.

Actually, a shield is considered a blunt weapon, and is held in the left hand (Non dominant hand). Where as the sword requires more fines, and precision (dominant hand) and is held in the right hand. A shield may be heavier, but its not swung with precision or as much as a sword.

> [{quoted}](name=NalleTheDefiller,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=15mRqfbn,comment-id=00070000,timestamp=2014-12-09T04:24:39.161+0000)
> Actually, a shield is considered a blunt weapon, and is held in the left hand (Non dominant hand). Where as the sword requires more fines, and precision (dominant hand) and is held in the right hand. A shield may be heavier, but its not swung with precision or as much as a sword.

That is true in a sword/shield fight, but in a phalanx formation (with a spear) i doubt it really matters as most of the shields have a part where you can put the spear and just pull and push, phalanx formations dont really need precision since you are only thrusting the spear back and forth, although historical records ilustrate that you had to shield not you, but your partner at your left side.

But Pantheon isn't and never was/will be a spartan because he's a Rakkor. While losely based upon Spartans it's hard to say whether they make shield walls or any other such stuff.  And I'm betting that sometime in the future when they flesh out the Rakkor more they will be even more divergent from Sparta. I totally wouldn't put it past Pantheon to be ambidexterity as well.

Also Runeterra doesn't necessarily have the same conventions as Earth. So it could be that left-handedness is simply more prevalent there.
The real question is why does it matter?
Has anyone actually counted the amount of left-handed versus right-handed champions and compared that to a real-world number? I mean, so many champions. Surely many must be righties.

Because Riot Reinboom has not won a match on blue side of the map since League launched. Developing a personal vendetta against blue-side, he forced the champion concept people to make every champion left-handed so their most awesome/dangerous side could only be seen when fighting from Red side. And now he can relish in the destruction of his enemies on the Blue side as he man-drops them to death from the most awesome visual angle possible.

And that is how left-handed baby champions are born.
It's interesting to note that the in game models are left handed for the champions you mentioned, but the splash art doesn't reflect that.
Ambidextrous master race unite!
Varus is ambidextrous

At least for Kalista, I'm assuming that it was (for future skins as well) to help distinguish her visually from Nidalee (who's right handed). For example, base Kalista and Headhunter Nidalee have somewhat similar color palettes. It's probably not the biggest visual difference that could have been made, but it could help in a minor way.

[As Emofratparty pointed out](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/x1P9xGde-sois-ashe-ambidextrous), Ashe could very well be ambidextrous.
